thread.title: Trump wants to break dubious record set by Nixon | New York Post
thread.title_full: Trump wants to break dubious record set by Nixon | New York Post

author: Daniel Halper
title: Trump wants to break dubious record set by Nixon | New York Post
text:
President Trump feels confident he can beat former President Nixon — and get on the cover of Time magazine more times than the chief executive who resigned in disgrace.
“Time magazine, which treats me horribly, but obviously I sell, I assume this is going to be a cover too, have I set the record? I guess, right? Covers, nobody’s had more covers,” Trump said in the interview published on Thursday .
When the reporter responded by saying Nixon, who stepped down in 1974 under the threat of impeachment, had Trump beat, the president said, “Ok good. I’m sure I’ll win.”
The sitdown, which claimed to be on “truth and falsehoods,” touched on other topics, too, like when Trump accused his former Republican rival Ted Cruz’s dad of being in on the John F. Kennedy assassination with Lee Harvey Oswald.
“Well that was in a newspaper. No, no, I like Ted Cruz, he’s a friend of mine. But that was in the newspaper,” Trump said in the Time interview.
“I wasn’t, I didn’t say that. I was referring to a newspaper. A Ted Cruz article referred to a newspaper story with, had a picture of Ted Cruz, his father, and Lee Harvey Oswald, having breakfast.”
The report about Cruz’s father appeared in the supermarket tabloid the “National Enquirer.”
Trump also maintained his claims that there was vast voter fraud in the last presidential campaign and that thousands of Muslims were cheering in New Jersey streets after the 9/11 terror attacks .
At the end of the interview, though, Trump pointed to his success by saying he’s the one in the White House.
“Hey look, in the meantime, I guess, I can’t be doing so badly, because I’m president, and you’re not. You know. Say hello to everybody OK?” he said, concluding the interview.
